main event: William A. Boyle observed a white, yellow, and red object standing still in the sky on March 7, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as a combination of white, yellow, and red colors., The sighting was made visually without any aids., The object appeared to be motionless in the sky during the observation., The witness was located in Sulphur Grove, Ohio., No photographs or images were included in the report.
sighted object: a white, yellow, and red object
witness description: William A. Boyle, a resident of Ohio
